description: A python and pyopencl based SPH simulation toolbox.
README.txt:
pyclsph 

current version: 0.1a






References:

1. 
PyCUDA and PyOpenCL: A scripting-based approach to GPU run-time code generation.
Andreas Klockner, Nicolas Pinto, Yunsup Lee, Bryan Catanzaro, Paul Ivanov, Ahmed Fasih. 
Parallel Computing, Volume 38, Issue 3, March 2012, Pages 157-174.

2. 
Implicit Incompressible SPH.
M. Ihmsen, J. Cornelis, B. Solenthaler, C. Horvath, M. Teschner,
IEEE Transactions on Visualization and Computer Graphics, July 2013. 

3.
A double layer method for constructing signed distance fields from triangle meshes.
Yizi Wu1, , Jiaju Man, , Ziqing Xie.
Graphical Models, Volume 76, Issue 4, July 2014, Pages 214-223

4.
Generating Optimal Initial Conditions for Smooth Particle Hydrodynamics Simulations.
Steven Diehl, Gabriel Rockefeller, Christopher L. Fryer, David Riethmiller, Thomas S. Statler.
arXiv:1211.0525 [astro-ph.IM], 2012
